websites.title: USAFacts Tracker
websites.description: Dive into the stats and data on all things COVID-19. Explore metrics including daily case counts, government spending to help people and businesses, health risk factors, and the virus's economic impact.

websites.title: Coronavirus Watch
websites.description: worldwide media, advanced visualizations and more

websites.title: Johns Hopkins Map
websites.description: COVID-19 Dashboard by the Center for Systems Science and Engineering (CSSE) at Johns Hopkins University (JHU)

websites.title: COVID Outbreak
websites.description: The COVID-19 pandemic, also known as the coronavirus pandemic, is an ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), first identified in December 2019 in Wuhan, China.

websites.title: CDC When To Quarantine
websites.description: Quarantine is used to keep someone who might have been exposed to COVID-19 away from others. Quarantine helps prevent spread of disease that can occur before a person knows they are sick or if they are infected with the virus without feeling symptoms.

websites.title: Reopening Hawaii
websites.description: Charting the course for Hawaiʻi’s recovery. Connecting Hawaiʻi residents and businesses to recovery resources and information.

websites.title: Safe Gatherings in Hawaii
websites.description: For months, we’ve been keeping physical distance in order to protect our community. But physical distance doesn’t have to mean social isolation—you can gather with friends, family, and co-workers…as long as you do it safely. Follow the simple guidance below to keep you and your ‘ohana safe, and keep Hawai‘i on the path to reopening.

websites.title: Tips for Studying at Home
websites.description: To help students stay productive while studying remotely, we've compiled some essential tips for staying focused at home.

websites.title: Free Online Courses due to COVID
websites.description: Online courses are offered by hundreds of colleges worldwide — for credit, not for credit, or just for fun. There are more than 5,000 Massive Open Online Courses (MOOCs) that are always free, but in response to the COVID-19 crisis, some online providers are offering additional free courses.

websites.title: UH Manoa mental health resources
websites.description: Students can call the CSDC at (808) 956-7927 to schedule an appointment with a counselor or to hear more about counseling resources on campus. We are located in the Queen Liliʻuokalani Center for Student Services, Room 312.

websites.title: UH Manoa Student Relief Funds
websites.description: Thanks to the generosity of our donors, the University of Hawaiʻi and The University of Hawaiʻi Foundation are humbled to announce this special opportunity for our students.

websites.title: Coping with Stress from COVID
websites.description: Recent studies have found that college students are experiencing a mental health crisis, which has worsened with the COVID-19 outbreak. In a new BestColleges survey, a staggering 81% of students reported feeling increased stress during the pandemic.

posts.title: This forest in Scotland
posts.description: This forest in Scotland. I wish I could remember where, it was near a tall thin castle on a hill with lots of arrow slits in its walls and a spiral stone staircase going up. Maybe it was because I was a kid but it felt like the most magical place, moss covered stairs that looked thousands of years old and the clearest streams. I’d love to go back but Scotland has lots of woods and castles.

posts.title: Back country whistler
posts.description: Back country whistler or the mountains in Switzerland

posts.title: Grand Canyon National Park
posts.description: Grand Canyon National Park in Arizona, USA. You can look at pictures and it's pretty, but in person it is absolutely breathtaking.

posts.title: Cool Title
posts.description: The Badlands. I saw a lot of amazing places on a road trip but the badlands at night with a whole sky of stars....that hits different.

posts.title: I love traveling
posts.description:
Glacier point - Yosemite hands down

Upper Yellowstone falls - Yellowstone. We saw it at sunset and it was absolutely incredible

posts.title: Sorrento, Italy
posts.description: Sorrento, Italy. Beautiful, small town in the south of Italy. Sitting there during a summer night, overlooking the Bay of Napoli, seeing the city lights of Napoli and Mount Vesuvius right beside it, words can't describe it.

posts.title: The Faroe islands
posts.description: The Faroe islands. It was just something else. Couldn't really believe what I was seeing and walking through was real. No trees, steep rocks, the grey North Atlantic ocean, foggy weather that could turn into bright sunshine within an hour. Few people on hiking routes, feeling of remoteness.

posts.title: Best spot I've been to
posts.description: Muir woods. I know there are plenty of more beautiful places, but I have been in person there...it is amazing and fills you with awe

posts.title: No where else is better than
posts.description: Tofino, BC, Canada. What an incredible place that is.

posts.title: Speechless
posts.description: Bay of Fundy as the tides changed is the most awe-inspiring site I've ever seen in person. Can't even put into words haw amazing it was.
